alert.note: Alert for Aransas Islands; Bee; Coastal Aransas; Coastal Kleberg; Coastal Nueces; Coastal Refugio; Coastal San Patricio; Duval; Inland Kleberg; Inland Nueces; Inland Refugio; Inland San Patricio; Jim Wells; Kleberg Islands; La Salle; Live Oak; McMullen; Nueces Islands; Webb (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Corpus Christi (Corpus Cristi, Victoria and Laredo)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued March 01 at 2:52AM CST until March 03 at 9:00AM CST by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: ...Critical Fire Weather Conditions Possible Thursday Afternoon through Friday Morning... .A strong cold front will move across South Texas Thursday evening. Strong northwest winds and low relative humidity are expected to pour into the area Thursday night and Friday behind the front. The combination of low relative humidity values and strong winds will likely result in critical fire weather conditions Thursday night and Friday. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR MOST OF SOUTH TEXAS... * AFFECTED AREA...La Salle, McMullen, Live Oak, Bee, Webb, Duval, Jim Wells, Inland Kleberg, Inland Nueces, Inland San Patricio, Coastal Aransas, Inland Refugio, Coastal Kleberg, Coastal Nueces, Coastal San Patricio, Aransas Islands, Coastal Refugio, Kleberg Islands and Nueces Islands. * TIMING...Thursday Afternoon through Friday Morning. * WINDS...West 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 9 percent. * TEMPERATURES...In the upper 70s. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
